info.document:
Share This

PRESS RELEASE - SAINT Lucia and other Caribbean islands now have the opportunity to access supplementary and remedial tutorial (commonly known as "after-school lessons") via the Internet.

Students due to write the Caribbean Secondary Education Certificate (CSEC/CXC), Caribbean Advanced Proficiency Examination (CAPE) and Common Entrance Examination (CEE) can now access (online) study content and material for their examinations in an environment that is secure, cost-effective, relatable and rewarding. (An Internet connection and laptop or tablet is all that is needed).

It is well-known that one of the contributing factors for poor CXC and Common Entrance performance is due to lack of preparation. For many years, parents juggled work and getting children to and from lessons classes. Fortunately, we now live in a world where learning is one click away.

Committed to promoting academic excellence, Aspyer has developed a suite of online products and services geared toward the enhancement of learning (or education) through interactivity and engagement.

Founded, developed and maintained by a team of Information Communication Technology (ICT) experts and teachers, Aspyer uses a blend of proprietary and open source technology intended to modernise the availability and delivery of educational content and study material (at primary, secondary and tertiary levels) in a manner that is relevant to today's students, sustainable and offers the best chance of success.

The website, www.aspyer.co, is where the learning happens. Students sign up online to gain access to interactive videos, virtual classrooms, one-on-one tutorials, SBA and homework help, practice exams while tracking their progress in a gamified environment.

Aspyer is passionate about students' success and is motivated by the prospects of enhancing education in the Caribbean. We wish all students a productive and successful 2017/2018 school year.

Log in at www.aspyer.co and let the learning begin.

Share This
